document.docTitle: Pheretima nagaensis Hong & James 2008, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new earthworms of the genus Pheretima (Oligochaeta: Megascolecidae) from Mt. Isarog, Luzon Island, Philippines

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new earthworms of the genus Pheretima (Oligochaeta: Megascolecidae) from Mt. Isarog, Luzon Island, Philippines

materialsCitation.collectorName: S. W. James & M. Levi & P. Nillos & Two & Same

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Clitellate specimen (NMA 004195): Philippines , Camarines Sur Province , Mt. Isarog ‘‘ Camp 3’’ (
13 ° 39.799N
,
123 ° 21.799E
),
1360 m
, mossy-montane forest transition, soil,
14 May 2001
, S. W. James , M. Levi , P. Nillos , and J. ffitch colls. Two paratypes : one clitellate (NMA 004200), one clitellate ( NIBR ): Same data as for holotype.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The species is named for its type locality in the vicinity of Naga City
.

One pair of spermathecal pores in 5/6 at ninth setal line, laterally placed, spermathecal pores 0.29 mm circumference apart; copulatory bursae with two large oval pads from medial sides, openings 0.25 mm circumference apart.

Medium brown dorsal pigment except around setae, and on segmental equators where setae are closely spaced. Dimensions 36–53 mm by 2.7–3.0 mm at segment x, 2.5–2.6 mm at xxx, 2.4–2.8 mm at clitellum, segments 57–76; body circular in crosssection. Setae numbering 31–38 at vii, 41–48 at xx; seven to ten between male pores, size and spacing differing between dorsal and ventral setae, setal formula AA:AB:YZ:ZZ51:1:3:4 at xiii. Clitellum annular xiv–xvi; setae invisible externally. Female pore on xiv in well-defined oval.

First dorsal pores 12/13. One pair of spermathecal pores in 5/6 at ninth setal lines, laterally placed, spermathecal pores 0.29 mm circumference apart. 0.4–0.5 mm transverse furrowed lip openings of copulatory bursae paired in xviii at eighth setal lines, openings 0.25 mm circumference apart. Genital markings lacking.

Table 1. Comparison of species of the
urceolata
group (modified from James 2004b ).

footnote.paragraph: ***F5floor R5roof, S5side of copulatory bursa interior

caption.paragraph:
Figure 2.
Pheretima nagaensis
sp. nov. (A) Ventral view; (B) spermathecae. Scale bars52.5 mm (A), 2 mm (B).

subSubSection.paragraph: Septa 5/6–7/8 thick, 8/9/10 absent, 10/11–13/14 thin. Gizzard long cylinder in viii–x, oesophagous with large blood supply xi–xiv but not lamellar; intestine begins in xvi, small paired lymph glands from xxvii along dorsal vessel; intestinal caeca simple originating in xxvii, and extending anteriorly about to xxiv, finger-shaped sac with smooth margins; typhlosole very small found from xxvii. Hearts xi–xiii oesophageal, x absent, ix lateral, viii to gizzard.

Ovaries and funnels in xiii, spermathecae one pair in vi, with a few nephridia on spermathecal ducts; spermatheca with large mushroom to globular-shaped ampulla, duct shorter than ampulla; diverticulum egg-shaped chamber, with slender stalk as long as ampulla. Male sexual system holandric, testes and funnels in ventral paired sacs in x–xi, large. Seminal vesicles two pairs xi–xii, prostates in xvii–xx glands in one or two lobes; if two lobes then lobes anterior, posterior to copulatory bursae; slender muscular ducts, entering central medial face of copulatory bursae without stalked glands; copulatory bursae with two large oval pads from medial sides, anterior, posterior; one small posterior-lateral pad from floor, one large block-like pad on floor below penis. Penis a broad oval with narrow low apex, on bursa roof.

Pheretima nagaensis
sp. nov. is distinguished from other members of the species group as discussed in remarks under
Pheretima abiadai
sp. nov.
